<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 3"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Folk Dowsing](/Feats.aspx?ID=3774) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 78</row>

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16)

</column>

---

You can find what you're looking for using a dowsing rod or pendulum. If you [Search](/Actions.aspx?ID=519) while wielding a dowsing rod or pendulum, in addition to the normal checks for Searching, the GM rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) check for you to detect the largest source of water, oil, or another natural non-bodily fluid in the area. Even if the liquid is concealed from you—for example, if it stems from an underground spring or is piped through a wall—this technique points you in the right direction. The GM determines the DC, which is usually the [trained simple DC](/Rules.aspx?ID=553) with a [hard or very hard adjustment](/Rules.aspx?ID=555) if the source of water is small.

 If you're an expert in Survival, the GM also makes a Survival check for you to detect sizable deposits of metal, minerals, and nearby graves. The DC is usually the expert simple DC, with DC adjustments for smaller deposits.
name: Folk Dowsing
